definition: to go straight to/to make a beeline for
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope

sentences.english: At that moment I understood why Larry rushed to the recording mahcine every time he went back home.
sentences.chinese: 我這才明白爲什麼拉瑞每天回家直奔電話錄音機。

sentences.english: The minute Tom came home he beelined for the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆一回到家就直奔冰箱而來。

sentences.english: Out of the station on a well-known straight away large hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 出了車站就直奔一家出名的大醫院而去。

sentences.english: Once you know, you can head down-market for the bargains.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你知道了，便可以直奔市場去購買了。

sentences.english: So I put my FLASHers on, grabbed my books, and marched down the road to the college.
sentences.chinese: 我只好把指示燈打亮，然後抓起課本直奔學校。

sentences.english: The Dragon Ball Team escapes their prison to search for Pilaf and the Dragon Balls.
sentences.chinese: 尋找龍珠的隊伍逃出了監獄，直奔皮拉夫和龍珠而去。

sentences.english: He escorted us at the customary racing-car speed to our guest villa.
sentences.chinese: 他陪同我們以慣常的賽車般的速度直奔賓館。

sentences.english: Fired point-blank at my heart by a Spanish arcabucero.
sentences.chinese: 子彈從西班牙火繩槍發出，直奔我的心臟。

sentences.english: The hungry boy made a bee-line for his dinner.
sentences.chinese: 那個飢餓的男孩直奔回家喫飯。

sentences.english: Lunchtime and the “good kids” made a beeline for it.
sentences.chinese: 午飯時分，“聽話的孩子”直奔這裏。

sentences.english: Later I found a tuk-tuk, rush rush rushed, straight to the mutton shop.
sentences.chinese: 後來找了輛三蹦子，突突突，直奔羊肉湯店。

sentences.english: Once he recaptures Paris, he’ll have a lot of confidence headed into Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 一旦他巴黎重溫，定會信心十足，直奔溫網寶座而去。

sentences.english: I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你開廣我心的時候，我就往你命令的道上直奔。

sentences.english: Then I saw a young man run up along the stairs with heavy steps.
sentences.chinese: 只見一個年輕人噔噔噔地順着臺階跑上來，直奔頂端。

sentences.english: Four minutes later he curled a fierce free-kick towards the top corner.
sentences.chinese: 四分鐘後他的大力任意球直奔球門上角。

sentences.english: He saw his assailant head straight for the Tour Magdala.
sentences.chinese: 他看到他的襲擊者朝着馬格達拉塔直奔。

definition: variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
